posts.title: Unleashing My Inner DJ with Gemini GV Series G2V
posts.content:
As a music maker free from the constraints of traditional instruments, I'm always on the lookout for tools that'll help me take my EDM songs to the next level. That's why I was stoked to try out the Gemini GV Series G2V DJ controller. 

First off, the touch sensitive jog wheel was smooth like lip gloss song on repeat, making it easy to cue up tracks, scratch, and nudge beats. Plus, the LED monitor displays all the important info I need at a glance, like track time, pitch, and bpm. I felt like a true record producer with this bad boy at my fingertips.

I was also impressed with the multiple inputs and outputs, including XLR, RCA, and 1/4-inch mic inputs, making it a versatile choice for any music engineering setup. And with the ability to map MIDI controls to my favorite software (I use Logic), I was able to customize the controller to my workflow. 

The Gemini GV Series G2V would be a great fit for anyone who wants an affordable controller that still packs a punch. Whether you're just starting out with online drum machine beats or you're a seasoned pro looking for a new toy, this controller won't disappoint. 

Pros:
- Touch sensitive jog wheel is smooth and responsive
- LED monitor displays essential info
- Multiple inputs and outputs for versatile use
- MIDI mappable controls for software customization
- Affordable price point

Cons:
- Some users have reported issues with the jog wheel losing sensitivity over time

In conclusion, the Gemini GV Series G2V is a solid choice for any dance electronic or electro pop producer looking for a user-friendly MIDI controller that won't break the bank. With its touch sensitive jog wheel, LED monitor, and customizability, it's a great option for anyone who wants to take their music to the next level. So go ahead and add it to your arsenal – your fans will thank you later. 

Bottom line: 9/10 – A versatile and affordable MIDI controller that won't disappoint.

product.name: Gemini GV Series G2V Professional Audio 2-Channel MIDI Mappable Virtual DJ Controller with Touch Sensitive Jog Wheel and LED Monitor

posts.title: DJ Ace's Fun Review of the Summina 25 Portable MIDI Keyboard: Make Beats On
posts.content:

First off, the 16 RGB backlit trigger pads are a dream come true. They're super responsive and perfect for creating drum beats on the fly. Plus, the 8 assignable control knobs make it easy to adjust parameters like volume, effects, and more. And all of this in a compact, portable design? Yes, please.

If you're just getting started with music production, this midi keyboard is a great choice. Another thing I love about this keyboard is how well it works with other software. Of course, no product is perfect. The only real downside to the Summina 25 is the color scheme. While the black and white design is sleek and modern, it might not be everyone's cup of tea. But honestly, that's a pretty minor issue in the grand scheme of things.

Overall, I highly recommend the Summina 25 Portable 25-Key USB MIDI Keyboard Controller. It's a great choice for music producers of all skill levels, and it's a fantastic value for the price. So go ahead and add it to your setup – you won't regret it!

- Responsive trigger pads and assignable control knobs

Bottom Line: If you're looking for a versatile and portable MIDI keyboard that won't break the bank, the Summina 25 is a great choice. posts.title: Pump up the Beat with Tama Rhythm Watch RW200!
posts.content:
As a DJ and music producer, I know the importance of keeping the tempo steady. That's why I'm excited to share my review of Tama Rhythm Watch RW200 with you! This nifty little gadget has everything a drummer needs to stay on track, whether you're performing live or recording in the studio.

One of the standout features of the RW200 is the large, easy-to-read backlit display. This is especially helpful when you're playing in low-light conditions, like a dimly lit club or basement studio. The dial for quick tempo adjustments is also a nice touch, so you can easily tweak the beat without missing a beat.

Another great thing about the RW200 is the separate volumes for quarter notes, eighths, and triplets. This gives you more control over the sound and helps you keep everything in sync. Plus, the durable housing and keypad means this watch will last you a long time, even with heavy use.

Overall, I think the Tama Rhythm Watch RW200 is a great investment for any drummer who wants to take their playing to the next level. It's especially useful for those who play live or record in the studio, but even hobbyist drummers can benefit from this handy gadget.

Pros:
- Large, easy-to-read backlit display
- Quick tempo adjustments dial
- Separate volumes for different note types
- Durable housing and keypad

Cons:
- Only available in black (not a big deal, but would be nice to have color options)

Bottom Line: If you're a drummer looking for a reliable metronome to keep you on tempo, the Tama Rhythm Watch RW200 is a great choice. With its easy-to-use features and durable design, this watch is sure to keep you on beat for years to come.

Rating: 9/10

product.name: Tama Rhythm Watch RW200

posts.title: Happy Land Vol. 2: Brit Electronic Music of the 90s - Blast from the Past o
posts.content:
Yo, what's up music lovers! It's your boy, DJ Ace, here to review Happy Land Vol. 2 Compendium Of Electronic Music From The British. This double vinyl LP brings together a collection of electronic music from the UK between 1992 and 1996. Yeah, I know, it's a blast from the past. But trust me, this album is a treasure trove of beats that still sound fresh and futuristic. 

The album covers different types of EDM like bleep & bass, breakbeat hardcore, and street soul, which were born out of multicultural inner-city communities. The tracks are a reflection of the turbulent times with an intense political and economic crisis in the UK. The sound of the album is distinctly British and unique, making it a must-have for any music enthusiast. 

One of the best things about this album is how it captures the essence of the 90s electronic music scene in the UK. The tracks are carefully curated to showcase the best of the era and the creativity of the artists. It's an excellent album for anyone interested in the history of electronic music. 

The album is also well-produced and mastered. The vinyl LP has a crisp sound quality that enhances the listening experience. Landr mastering has done a great job of making the tracks sound polished and professional. 

Pro:
- Captures the essence of 90s electronic music from the UK
- Tracks are carefully curated to showcase the best of the era and creativity of the artists
- Well-produced and mastered with crisp sound quality

Con:
- Limited appeal to those who aren't interested in electronic music or the history of the UK music scene

Bottom Line: Happy Land Vol. 2 Compendium Of Electronic Music From The British is a well-curated album that captures the essence of electronic music from the UK in the 90s. It's a must-have for any music enthusiast interested in the history of electronic music. DJ Ace gives it a solid 8 out of 10.

product.name: Happy Land Vol. 2 Compendium Of Electronic Music From The British

posts.title: Alesis SR-16 - The Drum Machine That Will Take Your Beats to the Next Level
posts.content:
If you're an aspiring music producer or an experienced record producer, you know how important it is to have a reliable drum machine by your side. The Alesis SR-16 is the drum machine that started a music revolution, and it's still one of the most popular drum machines ever made. As a music maker, free yourself from the limitations of pre-recorded loops and create your own unforgettable beats that will get people dancing like crazy!

The SR-16 features 233 realistic, natural drum sounds, offered both in dry form and sampled with our incomparable digital reverbs. With our exclusive Dynamic Articulation™ feature, the drum sound changes its tonal content as it's played harder for truly realistic performances. Plus, the SR-16 comes with 50 preset patterns captured by top studio drummers, not just programmed and quantized, and enough built-in rhythmic variations (with A, B and two Fill sections) for composing complete arrangements.

The SR-16 doesn't disappoint when it comes to customisation either! You can create and save your own customized patterns and songs with space for 200 totally unique user patterns. The SR-16 also provides complete MIDI implementation, a footswitch input, flexible programming and editing features and velocity-sensitive pad buttons. Plus, it's so easy to use that you'll be up-and-running and composing new music in minutes.

Whether you're creating EDM songs, electro pop, synth music, or drill music in Zion like Lupe Fiasco or Vince Staples' Ramona Park Brok, the Alesis SR-16 is the perfect companion for music engineering and record producing.

PROS:
- 233 realistic, natural drum sounds
- Exclusive Dynamic Articulation™ feature for truly realistic performances
- 50 preset patterns captured by top studio drummers, not just programmed and quantized
- Space for 200 totally unique user patterns
- Complete MIDI implementation, a footswitch input, flexible programming and editing features and velocity-sensitive pad buttons
- Easy-to-use

CONS:
- Limited sound library compared to some higher-end drum machines

Bottom Line: If you're looking for a reliable, easy-to-use drum machine with a realistic sound and plenty of customisation options, the Alesis SR-16 is the perfect choice. With its compact, studio-friendly footprint, this drum machine is perfect for music production at home or on the go. I would give this product an 8 out of 10.

product.name: Alesis SR-16 - Studio-Grade Standalone Drum Machine With On-Board Sound Library, Performance Driven I/O and In-Built Effects

posts.title: Electronic Music: Where the Magic Began
posts.content:
Are you a fan of EDM, Hip-Hop, or Pop beats? Do you know where electronic music came from? Electronic Music It Started Here / Various, a 2-disc compilation, is the perfect way to discover the pioneers of electronic music and their innovations in sound and science. DJ Ace, a music producer with several years of experience in music production, recommends this set to anyone who wants to learn more about the history of electronic music.

The tracks on this compilation are from artists and inventors who are responsible for the dawn of electronic music. These true innovators are the originators of the musical concepts that have developed into what we now know as electronica and dance. The first disc features Ray Cathode, Tom Dissevelt, Daphne Oram and many other notable composers. The second disc features John Cage, Karlheinz Stockhausen, Pierre Schaeffer, and other pioneers in the genre.

The set is ideal for music production enthusiasts who are interested in learning from the best of the best in the electronic music industry. It is perfect for those who want to experiment with new sounds and techniques, as well as those who want to create unique beats that stand out in the industry. The set includes a range of tracks that can be used as samples in music production, making it an excellent resource for those who want to start or improve their music production skills.

- The two-disc set includes a range of tracks that can be used as samples in music production.
- The set is perfect for music production enthusiasts who want to learn from the best of the best in the industry.

Cons:

- The compilation may not appeal to those who are not interested in the history of electronic music.

In conclusion, Electronic Music It Started Here / Various is an excellent resource for anyone interested in the history of electronic music. posts.title: Light Up Your Patch Game with Heinakroon LED CV Patch Cables Eurorack Modul
posts.content:
As a music producer, I know that patching a modular synth system is half the battle. But with the Heinakroon LED CV Patch Cables, it's game over! These patch cables are perfect for anyone looking to add some color and flair to their setup. The colored LEDs in each connector make it easy to see what's happening in your patch and the semitransparent rubber coating provides a comfortable grip, making it easy to handle.

These LED patch cables are compatible with Eurorack and feature dualcolored LED lights that light up when a signal is passing through the cable. The LED colors help to differentiate between positive and negative signals, which is extremely helpful when you're diagnosing a complex patch.

At 23.6 inches long, these cables are perfect for small to medium-sized modular systems. They're also great for performances, making it easy to patch synths even in dark conditions. The flashing LEDs add a certain flair to your performance, highlighting the rhythm of your music with red and green lights across your patch.

Pros:
- Colored LEDs in each connector make it easy to see what's happening in your patch
- Semitransparent rubber coating provides a comfortable grip
- Compatible with Eurorack
- Dual-colored LED lights differentiate between positive and negative signals
- 23.6 inches long, perfect for small to medium-sized modular systems
- Great for performances, making it easy to patch synths even in dark conditions

Cons:
- The LEDs may not be bright enough in very bright environments

In conclusion, the Heinakroon LED CV Patch Cables are a must-have for anyone who wants to add some color and flair to their patch game. They're perfect for both diagnostics and education, and the flashing LEDs make them great for performances. If you're looking for a way to light up your patch game, look no further than the Heinakroon LED CV Patch Cables!

As a DJ and music producer, I'm always on the lookout for new and innovative tools to help me create unique beats that stand out in the industry. That's why I was excited to try out New Electronic Music, a music beat maker that promises to take your music production to the next level.

One of the features that really stood out to me was the sampler. This is an essential tool for any music producer, as it allows you to create your own sounds and samples, and then use them in your beats. New Electronic Music's sampler is incredibly intuitive and easy to use, and it comes with a wide range of pre-loaded sounds to help you get started.

Another feature that I loved was the song keyfinder. This is a great tool for anyone who struggles with finding the right key for their beats. Simply load up your audio file or sample, and the keyfinder will do the rest. It's a real time-saver, and it ensures that your beats are always in key and sound professional.

If you're a fan of electronic music and EDM rave, you'll love New Electronic Music's synthesizer. This powerful tool allows you to create a wide range of sounds and effects, from deep basslines to soaring leads. And with the option to save and export your presets, you can easily reuse them across multiple tracks.

New Electronic Music is also the best DAW for Windows that I've used. It's incredibly stable and reliable, and it's packed with all the features you need to create professional-quality music. And with its intuitive interface and easy-to-use tools, you'll be able to start making beats right away.

Pro:
- Intuitive interface and easy-to-use tools
- Sampler and synthesizer are powerful and versatile
- Song keyfinder ensures that your beats are always in key
Con:
- Limited range of pre-loaded sounds

In conclusion, if you're looking for a music beat maker that's easy to use, packed with features, and won't break the bank, New Electronic Music is definitely worth checking out. It's a great choice for anyone who wants to make their own beats, whether you're a professional music producer or just starting out.

Bottom line: New Electronic Music is a must-have for anyone who wants to create their own electronic songs or EDM rave beats. With its powerful sampler and synthesizer, intuitive interface, and easy-to-use tools, it's the perfect choice for both beginners and experienced music producers. I give it a solid 8 out of 10 stars!

posts.title: Unleash Your Inner EDM Superstar with the Behringer DeepMind 6 Analog Synth
posts.content:
As a producer who's always on the lookout for the freshest sounds and hottest beats, I'm constantly searching for gear that can help me create music that hits hard and stands out from the crowd. That's why I was stoked to get my hands on the Behringer DeepMind 6 Analog Synthesizer, a powerful synth that lets you unlock a world of sonic possibilities.

Let's start with the basics. The DeepMind 6 features 37 keys and 6 voices, each with 2 oscillators and LFOs, 3 ADSR generators, and an 8-channel modulation matrix. This means you can create rich, complex sounds that evolve over time and blend together in endless combinations. Plus, with tablet remote control, you can tweak your settings on the fly and stay in the zone.

But what really sets the DeepMind 6 apart is its 4 FX engines, which include reverb, delay, chorus, and more. These effects can take your tracks to the next level, adding depth, space, and texture that make your beats come alive. And with a 32-step control sequencer, you can program intricate patterns that evolve over time and add movement and energy to your tracks.

Who would benefit from the DeepMind 6? I'd say anyone who's into electronic dance music, from underground techno to mainstream pop. Whether you're a bedroom producer or a festival headliner, you can use this synth to create tracks that sound like they were made by Kendrick Lamar, Mr. Morale and the Big Steppers, or any other EDM superstar. And with its affordable price point, it's accessible to anyone who's looking to up their game in the studio.

Of course, no product is perfect, so here are a few pros and cons to consider before buying:

Pros:
- 6 voices and 2 oscillators per voice for rich, complex sounds
- 4 FX engines for a variety of modulation and ambience
- 32-step control sequencer for intricate patterns and movement
- Affordable price point for a true analog synth

Cons:
- Only 37 keys, which could be limiting for some players
- Some users have reported issues with build quality and durability
- Limited options for automation and sound editing compared to some other synths

Overall, I'd say the Behringer DeepMind 6 Analog Synthesizer is a solid choice for anyone who's serious about electronic music production. It offers a lot of features and flexibility for a relatively low price, and it has a sound quality that can rival more expensive synths. Whether you're a seasoned pro or a newcomer to the game, the DeepMind 6 can help you create tracks that are sure to get people moving on the dance floor. So fire up your Logic Vinyl Days and get ready to take your music to the next level! 

Bottom line: 8.5/10

product.name: Behringer DeepMind 6 37-Key 6-Voice Analog Synthesizer

posts.title: The Kurzweil K2700: Bringing Electronic Music to the Next Level
posts.content:
Are you ready to take your music production to the next level? Look no further than the Kurzweil K2700 88-Key Synthesizer Workstation. With a deep sound library of over 1500 factory Programs and over 700 Multi combinations organized into 13 instrument categories, this synthesizer has the power to create unique beats that stand out in the industry. 

One of the standout features of the K2700 is its patented FlashPlay Technology, which provides the workstation with a staggering amount of horsepower. With up to 8 GB total capacity with zero-loading time and ultrafast performance, this synthesizer is perfect for creating EDM, Hip-Hop, and Pop beats that are sure to get you moving. 

But that's not all - the K2700 also has 3.5 Gigabytes User Sample Memory, allowing you to load up to 3.5 GB of your own custom samples into non-volatile flash memory. Supported sample formats include .WAV, .AIF (up to 16 bit / 96kHz) and Kurzweil formats (.FOR, .PC4, .P3K, .KRZ, .K25, .K26), so you can easily incorporate your own sounds into your beats. 

The K2700 also features V.A.S.T. Editing, which expands on Kurzweil’s legendary Variable Architecture Synthesis Technology offering 32 layers per program, deeply customizable signal paths, and a host of modular DSP tools including new oscillators, filters, and FX. And with a 6-Operator FM Engine with the ability to load original FM SysEx files, this synthesizer has the power to go far beyond classic FM synthesis. 

The bundle includes a Kurzweil K2700 88-Key Synthesizer Workstation, an Adjustable Pro Heavy-Duty Folding Z Keyboard Stand, Closed-Back Studio Monitor Headphones, 2 x 1/4-Inch TRS Instrument Cable (10-Feet), and a Furniture Style Flip-Top Piano Bench (Black). Whether you're a record producer, beat maker online, or simply a fan of electronic dance music, the Kurzweil K2700 is a must-have for anyone looking to take their music production to the next level. 

Pros:
- Deep sound library of over 1500 factory Programs and over 700 Multi combinations
- Patented FlashPlay Technology provides the workstation with a staggering amount of horsepower
- 3.5 Gigabytes User Sample Memory allows you to load up to 3.5 GB of your own custom samples 
- V.A.S.T. Editing expands on Kurzweil’s legendary Variable Architecture Synthesis Technology offering 32 layers per program
- 6-Operator FM Engine with the ability to load original FM SysEx files

Cons:
- Expensive price point 

In conclusion, the Kurzweil K2700 is an excellent choice for anyone looking to take their music production to the next level. With its powerful features, deep sound library, and ability to incorporate custom samples, this synthesizer is perfect for creating unique beats that stand out in the industry. While it may be on the expensive side, the K2700 is worth every penny for its top-notch sound quality and versatility. Overall, I give the Kurzweil K2700 a 9 out of 10.

posts.title: Unleash Your Inner Synth Wizard with the ASM Hydrasynth!
posts.content:
As a music producer who's always on the lookout for fresh sounds and unique textures, I was beyond excited to get my hands on the ASM Hydrasynth Digital Polyphonic Desktop Synthesizer. And let me tell you, this little beast did not disappoint! With its advanced wavetable synthesis engine, three oscillators, and dual wave mutators, the Hydrasynth packs a serious punch when it comes to tone generation. And the best part? The user interface is so intuitive and user-friendly that you can start crafting your own signature patches in no time.

One of my favorite features of the Hydrasynth is the 24 polyphonic pressure touch pads. These allow you to play the synth without needing to connect an external controller, which is a huge plus if you're like me and don't always want to be tethered to a keyboard. The pads are also pressure-sensitive, which gives you a ton of expressiveness and control over your sound. And with multiple pad layouts and scale modes to choose from, you can customize the playing experience to your liking.

Another standout feature of the Hydrasynth is the dual filter section. You can configure the filters in series or parallel, which gives you even more flexibility when it comes to shaping your sound. And with the built-in effects section, you can add even more depth and character to your patches. Whether you're looking for lush pads, gnarly basses, or otherworldly leads, the Hydrasynth has got you covered.

Of course, like any piece of gear, the Hydrasynth isn't perfect. One small downside is that the unit doesn't come with a power supply, so you'll need to purchase one separately if you don't already have one. But honestly, that's a minor quibble in the grand scheme of things.

Overall, I'd highly recommend the ASM Hydrasynth to any music producer or synth enthusiast who's looking for a powerful, versatile, and user-friendly synth that can handle a wide range of sounds and styles. Whether you're into EDM, hip-hop, pop, or any other genre, the Hydrasynth will help you unlock your creative potential and take your productions to the next level.

Pros:
- Advanced wavetable synthesis engine
- Three oscillators with 219 single cycle waveforms

This little bad boy is packed with features that will blow your mind and your eardrums. Trust me, I've been using it for a minute, and I'm never going back to my old synth.

First of all, this synth is hybrid, which means it combines digital and analog technologies to create a unique sound that is both classic and modern. You can choose from 11 digital oscillator modes and mix them with the analog filter and modulation matrix to create sounds that range from fat basslines to crazy leads to atmospheric pads. Plus, you can add spice to your beats with the sequencer and arpeggiator, which are hella fun to experiment with.

Another dope feature of the MicroFreak is its touch plate keyboard, which is super responsive and lets you play in ways you never thought possible. It also has a built-in speaker, so you can jam out wherever you are, whether you're in your studio, on the bus, or hiking in Zion (shoutout to Lupe Fiasco).

And if you're like me, you'll love it for its drum roll sound (seriously, it's so satisfying).

posts.content:
Hey, music lovers! DJ Ace here, and I'm bringing you the ultimate synthesizer for your music production needs. The Nord Lead A1 49-Key Analog Modeling Synthesizer is a true powerhouse that packs a punch with its 26-voice polyphony and four simultaneous synthesizer parts. Whether you're a fan of EDM, Hip-Hop, or Pop, this synthesizer will blow your socks off with its uncanny realism and immense sonic variety.

One of the best things about the Nord Lead A1 is its front panel interface, which simplifies the programming process and encourages experimentation. You don't have to be a pro to create the perfect sound with this synthesizer. Its new oscillator section generates 47 different waveforms, and its filter section features classic Low and High Pass filters, as well as stunning emulations of the diode and ladder filters from the legendary Mini and the TB-303 synthesizers.

But wait, there's more! The Nord Lead A1 also features an LFO with a choice of waveforms and a three-stage ADR/ASR Modulation Envelope. The Mod Envelope has its own velocity setting and even includes an Invert function. And don't forget about the effects section, which features two analog models of an Ensemble and Chorus to add classic warmth and analog feel.

So who is the Nord Lead A1 perfect for? Well, if you're a music producer looking for a synthesizer that is user-friendly yet delivers sensational results, then look no further. The Nord Lead A1 is an ideal fit for all musical genres, from Hip-Hop producing to trap producer piano enthusiasts.

posts.title: DJ Ace's Review: Outro Tempo Takes You on a Mesmerizing Musical Journey Thr
posts.content:
Get ready to travel deep into the heart of Brazil's electronic music scene with Outro Tempo: Electronic & Contemporary Music From Brazil 1978-92 / Var. This double vinyl LP compilation takes you on a mesmerizing journey through the outer reaches of Brazilian music, where indigenous rhythms mix with synthesizers, and where MPB mingles with drum computers to create a complex and beautiful tapestry of sound.

As someone who is always experimenting with new sounds and techniques to create unique beats that stand out in the industry, I can appreciate the level of innovation and experimentation that went into this release. The tracks on this compilation are full of ambient, jazz-fusion, and minimalistic elements that have been infused with the musical forms and spirituality of indigenous tribes from the Amazon.

What I appreciate most about this compilation is that it brings to light many obscure albums and artists that have been neglected by even the most avid collectors of Brazilian music. It includes highly sought after music by Andréa Daltro, Maria Rita, and Fernando Falcão, as well as unknown gems like those of Cinema, Carlinhos Santos, and Anno Luz.

The sound quality of this double LP is top-notch, and the vinyl itself is of great quality. The packaging is also very well done, with a beautiful cover that evokes the lush landscapes of Brazil. This release is a must-have for anyone who loves electronic music, Brazilian music, or just wants to experience a unique and mesmerizing musical journey.

Pros:
- A unique and mesmerizing journey through Brazil's electronic scene
- Features obscure albums and artists that have been neglected by even the most avid collectors of Brazilian music
- Excellent sound quality and vinyl packaging

Cons:

posts.title: Arturia MicroFreak Vocoder Bundle: The Freakin' Synth You Need!
posts.content:
As a music producer who's always on the lookout for unique sounds and experimental gear, the Arturia MicroFreak Vocoder Bundle had me intrigued from the start. This little bundle packs quite a punch with its hybrid analog/digital technology, touch-plate keyboard, and 16-band vocoder. Not to mention, it comes with a bunch of extras like a gooseneck microphone, MIDI cable, adapters, and even a polishing cloth!

The MicroFreak's 11 digital oscillators offer a range of variable modes that you can play around with until you find the perfect sound. The Plaits engine created by Mutable Instruments is a game-changer – it's open source and allows for endless possibilities when it comes to sound design. The built-in touch-plate keyboard is another highlight of the MicroFreak, with its pressure sensitivity and polyphonic aftertouch that can take your performances to the next level.

The MicroFreak also features a state-variable analog filter inspired by the 12 dB Oberheim SEM filter. This filter can help you create everything from screaming leads to whispering pads, and you can control it with the touch-plate keyboard pressure or the onboard sequencer. Speaking of the sequencer, it allows you to record up to four automations, edit notes per step, or use the Spice and Dice sequencer functions to generate happy accidents.

The MicroFreak Vocoder Bundle is perfect for musicians, sound designers, producers, and DJs at any experience level. It's a great addition to any music recording studio or live setup, especially if you're into electronic music, EDM, or even hip-hop beats. It's also very portable, so you can take it with you wherever you go.

posts.title: The OB-6 Analog Synthesizer: The Cream of the Crop Synth for Music Makers E
posts.content:
What do Vince Staples' Ramona Park Broke My Heart, Tyler the Creator's Call Me If You Get Lost songs, and drill music in Zion have in common? The answer is simple: they all use top-notch music production equipment, and the OB-6 Analog Synthesizer is no exception. As an experienced music producer, I must say that this synth is a game-changer. It's an all-analog, 6-voice poly synth with voltage-controlled oscillators, a state-variable filter, and voltage-controlled amplifiers, inspired by Tom Oberheim's original SEM design. And when you combine that with Dave Smith's expertise, you get a powerhouse of a synth.

The OB-6 Analog Synthesizer has some impressive features. It has six discrete analog voices with two oscillators per voice, a continuously variable wave shape, X-mod with 2 sources and 5 destinations, a 64-step polyphonic step sequencer, and dual digital effects that include faithful recreations of Tom's acclaimed phase shifter and ring modulator. This synth is a music maker's dream, making it perfect for EDM, Hip-Hop, and Pop beats.

The OB-6 Analog Synthesizer is perfect for anyone who wants to take their music production game to the next level. Whether you're a beginner or an expert producer, this synth is easy to use and has endless possibilities when creating unique beats. It's perfect for stage or studio use, and its four-octave, semi-weighted keyboard with velocity and channel aftertouch makes it easy to play.

Here's a pro-con list so you can make an informed decision:

Pros:
- All-analog, 6-voice poly synth with voltage-controlled oscillators, a state-variable filter, and voltage-controlled amplifiers.
- Dual digital effects that include faithful recreations of Tom's acclaimed phase shifter and ring modulator.
- Four-octave, semi-weighted keyboard with velocity and channel aftertouch.
- 64-step polyphonic step sequencer.
- Perfect for stage or studio use.

Cons:
- Expensive for beginners.
- Limited color options.

In conclusion, the OB-6 Analog Synthesizer is a top-of-the-line synth that will take your music production to the next level. As someone who has been in the industry for years, I can confidently say that this synth is worth the investment, and if you're serious about music production, this is the synth for you. Are you an aspiring DJ or music producer looking for the perfect headphones to make your own beats and produce top-quality electronic songs? Look no further than the Heddphone One Headphone! As a top EDM artist myself, I can confidently say that these headphones are a game-changer. 

First off, the sound quality is unparalleled. The Heddphone One uses the latest in planar magnetic technology, which means that the sound is crystal clear and incredibly detailed. With the Heddphone One, you'll be able to hear every nuance of your music, from the deep bass to the high treble. 

But the Heddphone One isn't just a great listening device - it's also an incredible tool for music production. The headphones are incredibly comfortable, so you can wear them for hours on end without any discomfort. And with the built-in Song KeyFinder and Music Sheet Creator, you'll be able to quickly and easily generate pro tunes that are perfectly suited to your style of music. 

The Heddphone One also comes with The Sampler, a powerful sampler that lets you create your own beats and loops with ease. And if you're looking for even more functionality, the headphones are compatible with a wide variety of music making software, including the popular Free Audio Editing Softwares and Audacity Audio Editing. 

Of course, as with any product, there are pros and cons. Here's a quick rundown of the Heddphone One's strengths and weaknesses:

Pros:
- Exceptional sound quality
- Comfortable to wear for extended periods
- Built-in Song KeyFinder and Music Sheet Creator
- The Sampler is a powerful tool for creating your own beats
- Compatible with a wide variety of music making software

Cons:
- Expensive
- Not suitable for use as a general-purpose headphone

In conclusion, if you're serious about producing top-quality electronic music, the Heddphone One is an essential tool. While it may be pricey, the exceptional sound quality and built-in production tools make it well worth the investment. As a top EDM artist, I highly recommend the Heddphone One to anyone looking to take their music production skills to the next level.

Bottom line: 9.5/10

product.name: Hedd phone One Headphone

With its breathtakingly fast pitch-detection technology, triple-core generator, and massive library of virtual guitars, basses, amps, and synth voices, this little box of wonders lets you create tones and textures that will set your music apart from the crowd.

Whether you're a hip hop producer, a trap producer, an indie electronic artist, or an electronic dance music maestro, the GR-55GK has got you covered. You can easily switch between different sounds and effects on the fly, thanks to the quick-access category buttons, and tweak your settings to your heart's content with the intuitive interface. And if you're a keyboardist or a piano player, you can even use the GK-3 pickup to turn your instrument into a synth wizard's dream come true.

Of course, like any piece of gear, the Roland GR-55GK Guitar Synthesizer with GK-3 Pickup has its pros and cons. Here's a quick rundown:

- Lightning-fast pitch detection and tracking

- Intuitive interface and quick-access category buttons
- GK-3 pickup lets you turn your guitar into a synth

Cons:

Overall, if you're a guitar player or a synth wizard looking to take your sound to the next level, the Roland GR-55GK Guitar Synthesizer with GK-3 Pickup is definitely worth checking out. posts.title: What a DMXing Good Time!
posts.content:
As a music producer, I'm always looking for the best ways to enhance my performances and live shows. The ADJ Products DMX Operator-384 is a game-changer for anyone looking to up their lighting effects game. This DMX controller is the ultimate tool for DJs, music producers, and anyone who wants to create a visually stunning show to match their sick beats.

One of the best features of the DMX Operator-384 is its versatility. With the ability to control up to 384 channels and 12 individual fixtures with 32 channels each, the possibilities are endless. The built-in microphone and fog operation make it easy to control small stage setups, and the 240 programmable scenes are perfect for creating custom light shows that sync up with your music.

As someone who loves experimenting with new sounds and techniques, I was thrilled to discover that the DMX Operator-384 is MIDI controllable. It also records up to 12 chases and 30 scene banks, making it easy to program and create complex lighting sequences. The 8 individual faders and 4 channel banks are easy to use and the joystick provides seamless programmability, even mid-set.

One minor downside to the DMX Operator-384 is that it can be a bit overwhelming for beginners. However, with a bit of practice and experimentation, even those new to DMX protocol will be able to master this powerful tool.

Overall, the ADJ Products DMX Operator-384 is the perfect solution for anyone looking to take their live shows to the next level. Its versatility, ease of use, and MIDI compatibility make it a must-have for DJs, music producers, and anyone who loves to create visually stunning performances. 

PROS: 
- Versatile and powerful tool for lighting effects 
- Controls up to 384 channels and 12 individual fixtures 
- Built-in microphone and fog operation 
- MIDI controllable 
- 240 programmable scenes 
- 8 individual faders and 4 channel banks 
- Joystick for easy programmability 

CONS: 
- May be overwhelming for beginners 

BOTTOM LINE: 
If you're serious about creating visually stunning performances that sync up perfectly with your sick beats, the ADJ Products DMX Operator-384 is the tool for you. Its versatility, ease of use, and MIDI compatibility make it a must-have for any music producer or DJ. I highly recommend this product, and give it an 8.7 out of 10.

The Sampler Inc. is also a great addition to this set. It's perfect for producers who want to make their own beats and experiment with different sounds. And if you're not a producer, it's still a lot of fun to play around with and see what kind of sounds you can come up with.

One thing to note is that while the album is titled "EDM 2015," some of the tracks are a bit older than that. But they're still great songs and definitely worth a listen. And honestly, who cares about the year as long as the beat is good?

Overall, I would highly recommend EDM 2015 by Various to any EDM fan, DJ, or producer. It's packed with pro tunes, and the song selection is top-notch. Plus, it's affordable and a great value for the price.

Pro:
-40 electrifying tracks from top EDM artists
-Song Keyfinder is a useful tool for DJs and producers
-Sampler Inc. is perfect for making your own beats

Con:
-Some tracks are a bit older than 2015

Bottom Line: EDM 2015 by Various is a must-have for any EDM enthusiast, DJ, or producer. With top-notch tracks and useful features like the Song Keyfinder and Sampler Inc., it's the perfect soundtrack for your next rave. I give it an 8.5 out of 10.

One of the coolest features of the Novation Circuit Mono Station is its three sequencer tracks, which benefit from the 32 velocity-sensitive RGB pads. This makes it super easy to create complex beats with multiple layers of sound, while also allowing for live performance and improvisation. The synth also has two oscillators, three distortion modes, and one multi-mode filter, which can be high-pass, low-pass, or band-pass.

But what really sets the Novation Circuit Mono Station apart is its ability to individually control the sync and tuning parameters of its two oscillators, allowing for endless sound design possibilities. Users can choose from four wave shapes (saw tooth, triangle, square, and sample + hold), a sub-oscillator, ring modulation, and noise generation, as well as apply high-pass, low-pass, and band-pass filters with slopes of 12dB and 24dB.

The Circuit Mono Station is perfect for music producers, rap beat makers, and anyone looking to create pro tunes with an analog sound. Its four-by-eight modulation matrix allows for complex modulation of pitch, pulse-width, amp, filter, distortion, or CV, while up to 64 patches can be loaded and saved on the device. It even has MIDI I/O, so other MIDI gear can be connected, and can be plugged into a Mac or PC for unlimited patch management using Components.

Now, let's break down the pros and cons of the Novation Circuit Mono Station:

Pros:
- Three sequencer tracks with 32 velocity-sensitive RGB pads
- Two oscillators with individually controlled sync and tuning parameters
- Four wave shapes, sub-oscillator, ring modulation, and noise generation
- High-pass, low-pass, and band-pass filters with slopes of 12dB and 24dB
- Four-by-eight modulation matrix for complex modulation
- MIDI I/O and USB connectivity for unlimited patch management

Cons:
- Limited polyphony due to paraphonic design
- No built-in effects like reverb or delay

In conclusion, the Novation Circuit Mono Station is an incredibly versatile and powerful paraphonic analog synthesizer that's perfect for music producers, beat makers, and electronic music enthusiasts. With its three sequencer tracks, two oscillators, and four-by-eight modulation matrix, the Circuit Mono Station is sure to take your beats to the next level. So if you're looking for an affordable and portable synth that packs a punch, look no further than the Novation Circuit Mono Station.

Bottom line: 4.5 out of 5 stars.

product.name: Novation Circuit Mono Station Paraphonic Analog Synthesizer

posts.title: DJ Ace Reviews the Moog Grandmother Semi-Modular Analog Synthesizer: The Ke
posts.content:
If you're an electronic music creator, you're probably always on the hunt for the best sounds, samples, and equipment. That's where the Moog Grandmother Semi-Modular Analog Synthesizer comes in. As a music producer who loves experimenting with unique sounds and techniques, I was blown away by the ease of use and unlimited potential of this synthesizer.

First of all, the Grandmother is a semi-modular synthesizer, which means no patching is required to create complex sounds and modulation. This makes it an excellent choice for both beginners and experienced creators looking to experiment with new sounds. But if you're like me and love to explore, the creative patching possibilities are endless, allowing you to unlock the infinite expanse of auditory inspiration.

The sound engine, modulation engine, and onboard spring reverb tank are completely analog, resulting in a sonic vocabulary of immeasurable beauty and power. The classic 4-pole 10Hz-20kHz ladder filter, patchable 1-pole high pass filter, and analog ADSR envelope generator are just a few of the features that give the Grandmother its unique sound.

But that's not all. The Grandmother also features an easy-to-use arpeggiator and sequencer, allowing you to store up to three sequences with up to 256 notes each. The 32-note Fatar keyboard with velocity and analog LFO with audio-rate capabilities are just the icing on the cake.

As someone who is always looking for new ways to create unique beats, I appreciate the Grandmother's ability to process external sounds with its hardware spring reverb, and its compatibility with Mother-32, DFAM, Eurorack modular systems, and more. Plus, the Moog RES-COV-GRAND Water Repellant Dust Cover is the perfect accessory to protect your investment when you're not using it.

PROS:
- Easy to use for beginners and experienced creators
- Endless creative patching possibilities
- Completely analog sound engine and modulation engine
- Hardware spring reverb can process external sounds
- Compatible with other modular systems
- Includes dust cover for protection

CONS:
- Expensive compared to other synthesizers
- Limited to 32-note Fatar keyboard

In conclusion, the Moog Grandmother Semi-Modular Analog Synthesizer is a must-have for music creators looking to unlock infinite auditory inspiration. Its ease of use, analog sound engine, and compatibility with other systems make it a versatile tool for both beginners and experienced creators. While it may be expensive, the investment is well worth it for the unique sounds and creative potential that the Grandmother offers. I give it a solid 9 out of 10.

product.name: Moog Grandmother Semi-Modular Analog Synthesizer w/Dust Cover

- Can work as a sequencer or handheld keyboard

CONS:

In conclusion, the Division 6 Business Card Sequencer V2 Kit is a great addition to any record producer’s toolkit. posts.title: Unleash Your Inner Animal with Nils Frahm's "Music for Animals"
posts.content:
DJ Ace here, and I'm stoked to be sharing my thoughts on Nils Frahm's latest album, "Music for Animals." This isn't your typical EDM, Hip-Hop, or Pop beats album, but don't let that turn you off. Frahm's creative approach to music production shines through in this album, which is an ambient masterpiece. Clocking in at over three hours, "Music for Animals" offers an immersive experience that invites you to bask in its tranquility. 

I have to say that the absence of a piano in this album is a bold move, but it works. The focus on tone, timbre, and texture creates a mesmerizing soundscape that sets this album apart from anything else. Frahm's inspiration for this album was something as mesmerizing as watching a great waterfall or the leaves on a tree in a storm. He captures the essence of these natural elements in this album without any development or outcome, as he puts it. 

This album is perfect for those who want to unwind after a long day or meditate. It's an excellent fit for indie electronic fans and anyone who appreciates ambient music. The 3CD set and 4LP vinyl edition are both well-packaged with premium quality sleeves, making them a great addition to any music lover's collection.

Pros:
- Unique and mesmerizing soundscape
- Offers an immersive experience
- Premium quality packaging for both the 3CD set and 4LP vinyl edition

Cons:
- Might not be for those who prefer fast-paced music
- Might not appeal to fans of Frahm's previous work that featured the piano

In conclusion, "Music for Animals" is a bold and ambitious album that showcases Frahm's creative approach to music production. It's an excellent fit for indie electronic fans and anyone who appreciates ambient music. The absence of a piano in this album is a bold move that paid off, creating a unique and mesmerizing soundscape. The packaging for both the 3CD set and 4LP vinyl edition is of premium quality, making them a great addition to any music lover's collection. I give "Music for Animals" an 8.5 out of 10!

product.name: Music for Animals

posts.title: Mix like a pro with myVolts mickXer 5-way Passive Mixer with Noise Filterin
posts.content:
Are you tired of messy and complicated mixers? Look no further than myVolts mickXer! This little device is perfect for DJs, electronic music producers, and anyone who needs to mix multiple stereo inputs down to one output. And it comes in Go-Faster Red, so you know it's fast and furious!

One of the best things about mickXer is its noise filtering technology. No more annoying hums or ground loop noises messing up your recordings or live sets. And because it's fully passive, there's no need to worry about batteries or power supplies.

But what really sets mickXer apart is its versatility. With five stereo input channels and one output channel, you can mix anything from Korg Volcas to Teenage Engineering Pocket Operators to your heart's content. And if you need even more inputs, multiple mickXers can be daisy chained.

The microsuction feet are also a nice touch. They keep the mickXer securely in place on any surface without leaving any sticky residue. And let's not forget the sleek Go-Faster Red design. It's sure to make a statement in any studio or live setup.

Of course, no product is perfect. One minor con is that mickXer is not intended as a standalone device and should be connected to either a recorder or amplification device. But that's a small price to pay for such a handy and affordable mixer.

Overall, myVolts mickXer is a must-have for any music producer or DJ looking for a compact, high-quality mixer. And with a price point of just $21.49, it's a steal. DJ Ace gives it a solid 8/10.

product.name: myVolts mickXer 5-way Passive Mixer with Noise Filtering - Go-Faster Red

posts.title: Saddle up for Some Old-School Western Vibes with Marty Robbins' Gunfighter
posts.content:
Yeehaw, partners! If you're looking for some classic western tunes to get you in the cowboy mood, then you've come to the right place. DJ Ace here, and I've been jamming to Marty Robbins' Gunfighter Ballads & Trail Songs LP for a hot minute now, and let me tell you, it's got me feeling like I'm about to ride off into the sunset on my trusty steed.

This album is chock-full of catchy, foot-stomping tunes that'll transport you back to the wild west. Robbins' smooth crooning is backed by twangy guitars, harmonicas, and even the occasional whip crack. Whether you're looking for a song to serenade your sweetheart or a tune to sing along to around the campfire, this LP has got you covered.

One of my favorite things about this album is the variety of songs. You've got your ballads like "El Paso" and "Big Iron," your upbeat numbers like "Cool Water" and "Billy the Kid," and even a couple of eerie tracks like "They're Hanging Me Tonight." It's like a whole western movie soundtrack in one LP.

Who would this album be a good fit for, you ask? Well, if you're a fan of old-school country music or western movies, then you'll definitely appreciate this LP. It's also great for anyone who wants to add a little bit of western flair to their music collection or DJ set. And if you're like me and you love experimenting with different genres and sounds, then this LP is a must-have.

Pros:

Cons:

In conclusion, Marty Robbins' Gunfighter Ballads & Trail Songs LP is a classic western masterpiece that's sure to get your toes tapping and your heart racing. The album is a compilation of material that Field Medic recorded and released over two years from a small sunroom in San Francisco. His emphasis on fingerstyle guitar and lyrics, and incorporation of new elements like analogue drum machines and Casio keyboards, make for a magical and experimental listening experience.

One of the standout tracks for me was "ramona park broke my heart," which features a drum roll sound that really makes the track stand out. posts.title: Actual Life 2: A Synth-Pop Diary of Hard Times
posts.content:
Actual Life 2 (February 2-October 15 2021) is one of the most introspective and personal albums I've listened to in a while. As a record producer and fan of electronic and synth music, I appreciate the unique approach that the British multi-instrumentalist took in creating this album. He used found sounds, vocal clips, and a variety of electronic tools like ElectraX and Splice Beat Maker to craft a musical diary of the most difficult 8-month period of his life. 

The songs in Actual Life 2 feature catchy beats and melodies that capture the ups and downs of everyday life. From the lip gloss song 'Billie (Your Loving Arms)' to the poignant 'Hannah (The Sun)' and the groovy 'Faisal (Envelops Me)', the album has a little bit of everything for fans of synth-pop, electro pop, and even drill music in Zion. The drum roll sound and the use of vinyl days logic add a vintage touch to the overall sound, which I think works well with the themes of nostalgia and reflection in the album. 

If you're an aspiring musician or simply a music enthusiast, you'll appreciate the online drum machine and the online audio trimmer that the artist used to create some of the tracks in Actual Life 2. You can also benefit from the Landr mastering service that he used to give the final touch to the tracks. 

Pros:
- Unique approach to music production that blends found sounds and electronic tools
- Catchy beats and melodies that capture the ups and downs of everyday life
- Features a variety of electronic genres, from synth-pop to drill music in Zion
- Use of vintage elements like vinyl days logic that add a nostalgic touch to the sound
- Online drum machine and audio trimmer available for aspiring musicians
- Use of Landr mastering service to give the final touch to the tracks

Cons:
- Some tracks may feel overly introspective or personal for some listeners

Overall, Actual Life 2 is a great album that showcases the talent and creativity of a young and passionate musician. It's a synth-pop diary of hard times that's relatable, catchy, and deeply personal. Whether you're a fan of Vince Staples magic or Tyler the Creator cal, you'll find something to enjoy in this album. 

Bottom line: Actual Life 2 is a unique and personal blend of synth-pop, electro pop, and even drill music in Zion that captures the ups and downs of everyday life. Recommended for fans of electronic music and anyone looking for a relatable and catchy musical diary. Rating: 8/10.

posts.title: Feeling Magical with Feel Again: A DJ's Perspective
posts.content:
If you're a fan of electronic dance music, you're probably familiar with Armin van Buuren's work as a record producer and DJ extraordinaire. But have you checked out his latest album, Feel Again? As a music producer myself, I was curious to see what this album had in store, and I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised.

One of the standout features of Feel Again is its sheer variety. With 34 tracks, there's something for everyone here, whether you're into electro-pop, synth music, or even drill music (shoutout to Lupe Fiasco and Vince Staples for their contributions to "Drill Music in Zion" and "Ramona Park Broke My Heart", respectively). The album also features guest appearances from the likes of Logic and Ty Dolla $ign, adding a nice touch of diversity to the proceedings.

But what really impressed me about Feel Again was its sense of magic. From the dreamy, otherworldly sounds of "No Fun" to the pulsing, energetic beats of "Computers Take Over The World", each track transports you to a different realm of musical experience. And even when the album slows down for more introspective moments (such as "Roll The Dice"), it never loses that sense of enchantment.

Of course, no album is perfect, and Feel Again does have its cons. For one thing, at 34 tracks, it can be a bit overwhelming to take in all at once. I found myself needing to take breaks and come back to the album later in order to fully appreciate everything that was going on. Additionally, some of the tracks (such as "Come Around Again") can feel a bit repetitive, relying on the same musical motifs for too long.

But overall, I think Feel Again is a great album for anyone who wants to get lost in the world of electronic music. Whether you're a seasoned fan of Armin van Buuren's work or just looking for something new to add to your playlist, this album is sure to satisfy. So go ahead and let yourself feel again - you won't regret it.

Pros:
- Incredible variety of musical styles and guest appearances
- Sense of magic and enchantment that permeates the entire album
- Represents a powerful journey of self-discovery and personal growth

Cons:
- Some tracks can feel repetitive or overly long
- With 34 tracks, can be overwhelming to take in all at once

Bottom line:
With its diverse range of sounds and powerful emotional journey, Feel Again is a must-listen for any fans of electronic dance music. Rating: 9/10

product.name: Feel Again

posts.title: Porter Robinson's Worlds: A Game-Changing Album That Will Blow Your Mind
posts.content:
As a music producer, I'm always on the lookout for new sounds and techniques to elevate my craft. That's why I was drawn to Porter Robinson's Worlds, a double vinyl LP that promises to change the game on what Electronic Music can be. And let me tell you, it did not disappoint.

From the moment I pressed play, I was transported to a different dimension of sound. Robinson seamlessly blends the sonics and song craft of M83, Passion Pit, and Skrillex into one epic package that is both ambitious and accessible. The album adds a sleek and heartfelt Alt-Pop sensibility to the larger-than-life dynamics of modern Dance music, resulting in a superlative work that will blow your mind.

Worlds is a must-have for any music lover, but it's especially perfect for those who enjoy EDM, Hip-Hop, and Pop beats. The album features a wide range of sounds and styles, from Lupe Fiasco's drill music in Zion to Vince Staples' Ramona Park Broke My Heart. Tyler, the Creator's Call Me If You Get Lost songs and Logic's Cream song are also thrown into the mix, making for an eclectic and unforgettable listening experience.

Whether you're a seasoned music producer like myself or just a casual listener, you'll appreciate the attention to detail and care that went into the audio production of Worlds. It's clear that Robinson poured his heart and soul into this album, and it shows in every note and beat.

Pro:
- Ambitious and accessible album that changes the game on what Electronic Music can be
- Blend of sonics and song craft from different genres and styles
- Perfect for EDM, Hip-Hop, and Pop lovers

Con:
- Only available as a double vinyl LP, which may not be suitable for everyone

In conclusion, if you're looking for a game-changing album that will blow your mind and expand your musical horizons, look no further than Worlds. Porter Robinson's masterpiece is a must-have for any music lover, and I highly recommend it. With its unique and innovative approach to music production, Worlds is sure to inspire and amaze you.

Bottom line: 9.5/10
